title: First Nations
summary: The First Nations (French: Premières Nations [pʁəmjɛʁ nasjɔ̃]) are groups of Canadian indigenous peoples, who are classified as distinct from the Inuit and Métis.[2] Traditionally, the First Nations were peoples who lived south of the tree line, and mainly south of the Arctic Circle. There are 634[3] recognized First Nations governments or bands across Canada. Roughly half are located in the provinces of Ontario and British Columbia.[4]
